required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: I USE LR in the ED
clinical_study.official_title: Intermountain Utah Study Evaluating the Implementation of Lactated Ringers as Standard Resuscitation Fluid Starting in Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: To study the difference in mortality and major adverse kidney events during and after treatment in the emergency department with intravenous fluids per standard of care at 30 days before and after the system-wide implementation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with major Adverse Kidney Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days or at hospital discharge
primary_outcome.description: death from any cause, new renal replacement therapy or persistent renal dysfunction

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (an average of 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of LR IV fluids following implementation

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of hospital admission and readmission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 30 days of initial ED encounter
Through study completion (an average of 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Direct costs of ED care and hospitalization

intervention.description: Patients in this group will be included in the project

study_pop.textblock: Data to determine study outcomes will be extracted from the EDW and stored in a secure database. No actualy contact with patients will take place for this data-only study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (≥18 years) receiving a minimum of 1000ml of intravenous fluids starting in the emergency department per standard of care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged ≤17 years
- Previously enrolled patients with >1 ED admission within the 30-day follow-up period
